paper.title: Volatility forecasting from multiscale and high-dimensional market data
paper.abstract: Advantages and limitations of the existing volatility models for forecasting foreign-exchange and stock market volatility from multiscale and high-dimensional data have been identified. Support vector machines (SVM) have been proposed as a complimentary volatility model that is capable of effectively extracting information from multiscale and high-dimensional market data. SVM-based models can handle both long memory and multiscale effects of inhomogeneous markets without restrictive assumptions and approximations required by other models. Preliminary results with foreign-exchange data suggest that SVM can effectively work with high-dimensional inputs to account for volatility long-memory and multiscale effects. Advantages of the SVM-based models are expected to be of the utmost importance in the emerging field of high-frequency finance and in multivariate models for portfolio risk management. domain_result.justification: 该论文主要研究利用支持向量机（SVM）从多尺度高维市场数据中预测波动率，并提到其在投资组合风险管理中的应用。波动率预测是金融风险管理的核心内容之一，而论文明确提到了其在投资组合风险管理中的潜在应用。
